roastedbyai.models module

class roastedbyai.models.Style[source]

Bases: object

An auxiliary class to make it easier to view and select a style for a Conversation.

adult = 'adult'
all = ['default', 'crypto_bro', 'new_york', 'south_london', 'surfer_dude', 'valley_girl', 'adult']

roastedbyai.roasted module

class roastedbyai.roasted.Conversation(style: str = 'default')[source]

Bases: object

An instance of this class represents a conversation with the AI. Create a new instance of this class if this conversation reached its message limit.

property aimessages: list

Get the list of the AI’s messages.

Returns:

list: the list of messages

property alive: bool

Whether you are still able to participate in this Conversation. If this returns False, you can no longer use the Conversation.send function, but you can still access the message history.

Returns:

bool: True if you can still send messages, else False

property history: List[dict]

Return the full history of this Conversation.

[ {“role”: “assistant”,”content”: “…”}, {“role”: “user”,”content”: “…”}, … ]

Returns:

list[dict]: the history list which contains dicts

kill() → None[source]

Quit and close the conversation. User and AI messages are still available using Conversation.usermessages and Conversation.aimessages. The full conversation is available in Conversation.history.

send(message: str) → str[source]

Sends the user input to the AI and the AI returns a roast as output.

Parameters:

message (str) – str: the user input for the AI (max character limit of 250)

Returns:

returns a string containing the AI’s (roast) response to the user’s input

property style: str

Returns the talking style of this Conversation.

Returns:

roastedbyai.models.Style: the style

property usermessages: list

Get the list of the user’s messages.

Returns:

list: the list of messages
